titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Alan Klein Papers
ca. 1980-1995
MSS 118 MSS 118
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Processed by: Matt Moore, 2001.

editionstmt.p: This version was derived from Klein FindingAid.doc

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2012-02-15T17:19-0500

did.abstract: The Alan Klein Papers represent Klein's, a New York based public relations consultant and long-time gay activist, collection of materials that chronicle the Gay-rights movement. The collection includes correspondence, flyers, periodicals, press clippings, T-shirts and other materials which focus on the activities of Act Up (AIDS Coalition to Unleash Power), and Queer Nation, among others.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Open to researchers. Appointments are necessary for the use of manuscript and archival materials.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Collection use is subject to all copyright laws. Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the Director of Fales Library and Special Collections. Please contact fales.library@nyu.edu. or call 212 998 2596.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note:
bioghist.p: Alan Klein, a New York based public relations consultant, has been a long-time gay activist and was recently the Communications Director at the Gay and Lesbian Alliance Against Defamation ( GLAAD). He collected these materials which chronicle the gay-rights struggle through the 1980's and early 1990's.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Alan Klein Papers are a part of the Downtown Collection at the Fales Library, New York University. The Fales Library is the primary special collections division of the NYU Libraries, housing nearly 200,000 volumes of English and American literature from 1700 to the present. Strengths of the collection include the development of the English and American novel, with an emphasis on the Gothic and the Victorian novel, and the post-1975 Downtown New York scene.

The Alan Klein Papers are a diverse collection of materials, including correspondence, fact sheets, flyers, healthcare reports, minutes, periodicals, press clippings, T-shirts and other materials, which collectively document the activities of Act Up (AIDS Coalition to Unleash Power) and Queer Nation, as well as the social and political issues central to their causes. Throughout the processing of these papers, Klein's original folder groupings and titles were maintained as much as possible. These folders were then filed alphabetically under the series titles Act Up, Queer Nation, AIDS, and General Files based on the content of their materials.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The files are grouped into six series.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: There is no information about materials that are associated by provenance to the described materials but that have been physically separated or removed.
